intro: Echites andinus, commonly known as the Andean spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or arid soils. Its structure includes a basal rosette of leaves with a central stem bearing yellowish-green flowers. Echites andinus is adapted to harsh climates and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects.
